title: Review: The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart – Say No To Love
body:
![](http://woxy.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2009/03/pains1.jpg "POBPAH")Not only one of my favourite band names from recent years, but also the creators of a contender for my favourite debut record of last decade, New York twee pop group **The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart** are back with _Say No To Love_, the lead single from their sophomore album. A year on since their first full length release, and much critical acclaim from numerous music editorials such a NME and Q; _Say No To Love_ continues in the same vein as much of their self titled debut. An impressively well crafted pop track, it is certain to propel them further into the public domain, with **Kip Berman’s** vocals hovering delicately over the surf pop and shoegaze influenced guitar riffs. However, one noticeable improvement is in the lyrics, far more storytelling than anything featured on their previous LP, and more emotionally hard hitting, recounting the story of a missing lover with “_hearts on your sleeve_“, whilst “_trying hard not to say, what you just don’t feel_“. _Say No To Love_ will be released in an exclusive 7″ format, with b-side _Lost Saint_, which is another gem, reaffirming the band as a mouth watering prospect for the future.
